assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: LRRK2 mutations are associated with familial and idiopathic PD through increased kinase activity, suggesting a gain-of-function mechanism.
In vitro analysis of catalytic properties (autokinase, phosphotransferase) aligns with the disease mechanism.
No specific variant controls (e.g., known pathogenic/neutral variants) are mentioned, but the assay is broadly accepted in the field.
Multiple variants with PD show increased kinase activity, but no explicit OddsPath calculation.
